Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar with convex body and short, cylindrical neck, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is slightly grooved, the exterior is covered with a cream-coloured slip and very faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393451) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393451)
